newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT - CITIC a long-term buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - CITIC a long-term buy.

text.p: Merrill Lynch said it upgraded CITIC Pacific to a long-term buy from a long-term accumulate and raised its 1996 and 1997 earnings estimates for the company.
In a report dated August 28, Merrill said it maintained an intermediate-term accumulate rating on the stock.
Following CITIC's interim results, Merrill said it raised its 1996 earnings estimate by 56 percent to HK$6.38 billion and its earnings per share forecast to HK$2.99 from HK$1.92.
It raised its 1997 EPS forecast to HK$2.81 from HK$2.27 and said property income was expected to boost underlying profits to HK$4.68 billion.
Merrill said CITIC could book more than HK$1.3 billion in property profits in 1997 if it sold its new Quarry Bay office.
"Even if no buyer turns up, further disposal of HK Telecom shares could keep 1997 total profits at above HK$6,000 million."
Merrill said current price levels already reflected exceptional growth this year and partly discounted the possibility of similar levels next year.

But certain fundamentals strengths -- a large portfolio of inexpensive land bank, high quality recurrent income, stakes in two Hong Kong airlines, lucrative China infrastructure investments -- were far from being fully discounted.
